newsitem.title: USA: EIS shrs off on contract dispute -- traders.
newsitem.headline: EIS shrs off on contract dispute -- traders.

text.p: Shares in EIS International Inc fell sharply in afternoon Nasdaq trade on Friday as investors became aware of the potential departure of a top customer at an EIS unit, Wall Street traders said.
Two hours before the market close, EIS was off three points at 15-7/8 on volume of more than two million shares -- ten times the stock's average daily volume.
Earlier in the afternoon the shares fell as low as 14-5/8 after starting the day with a 1/8 rise to 19.

The traders said EIS, a maker of call center management systems, conducted an early-afternoon conference call to detail a contract issue, which was included in the company's latest 10-Q filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.

One trader said an unhappy customer was arguing that the service did not live up to company claims and was filing a claim to break the contract and possibly recover payment made to the EIS unit so far.
No one was immediately available at Stamford, Conn.-based EIS to explain the dispute or detail the conference call.
The trader said the contract in question was placed with EIS's Cybernetics unit, a workforce management software company acquired earlier this year.
He said that according to the 10-Q filing, the company has recognized $3.8 million in income through June 30 related to the contract.
In the 10-Q, he said, EIS said an escrow account had been established to cover costs associated with any termination of the contract, though the company said it expected the issue to be resolved.
In the second quarter the company reported income of $0.27 per share, or $3.1 million, versus $0.21 per share, or $2.2 million, in the year-ago period.
Second quarter revenues grew to $30.6 million from $20.8 million in the 1995 second quarter.
The company went public in July 1992 with a 1.725 million-share offering at $5 per share.
